social_posts.post_text:
Location: 🇦🇷 I danced in front of the Obelisco needle in Buenos Aires,  Argentina! 

Viva Argentina! The Winners! The Victors! 💙🤍🌎🏆⚽️🇦🇷
This time for Argentina - Waka Waka Ey Ey! 💙

Abrazo fuerte - To the beautiful land and it’s beautiful people playing the beautiful sport! 

I love you Argentina always and forever! Viva Argentina! - Pritan Ambroase 💙🤍😘🤗🇦🇷

My love for love, my love for the world and all the people and all it’s cultures, my love for our world uniting, my love for dance means I celebrate Argentina’s win even though I am from a land far away called England ❤️

I love love! 😘❤️🌍🌏🕊

#argentina #buenosaires #worldcup #leomessi #lionelmessi #messi #france #worldcup2022 #soccer #tango #ba #argentinian #diegomaradona #maradona #goat #france #fifa #dance #dancing #comedy #cool #sports #mbappe

When people ask me what I am the best at? what is my expertise? what my greatest achievement is? 🏆

My answer - The only thing I can say with absolute guarantee is that - I am the best at loving, I am the best at romancing, I am the best at love ❤️ . I love without caring about what the whole world thinks, I don’t even care what my family and friends think, I don’t even care what I think…… I only care about how I feel. I love beautifully so that it wakes you up and changes your life for the better, I love kindly so that it makes you learn to love yourself, I love perfectly so that you know are appreciated and valued….. everyday! ✨

That is why I accept only the best love, never compromise. And the greatest love comes with courage and doubtless loyalty and faithfulness. It requires no understanding, it must surrender to only feeling. I love with all of myself and more.” - Pritan Ambroase ❤️ always and forever 

Thank you to everyone who made this particular night and this particular weekend - some of the most amazing days and nights of my life. You all know who you all are. 👑🎉

I write this as I am on a flight to carry out a project. Let’s just say “Slava Ukraini”. And one of my greatest idols, 2 time Oscar winning musician A.R. Rahman has joined hands with me on my film ‘Can I Go Home Now?’ A title that has followed me for 10 years through 7 different projects. The music in the video is a divine creation of @arrahman - the musical philosopher, the sage and the poet. 

Thank you AR! @arrahman For the gift of your partnership, friendship and above all, the medicine of your music. I simply cannot wait for the magic we will create together while enriching Cinema and saving thousands of lives. 

When I was 14, I had written in my journal that “I will write my own history and story” and that “the story of my life will be an extraordinary and happy one filled with the most beautiful that life has to offer”. 

Here I am, all these years later, continuing to fulfil the promise I made to that teenage Pritan who was full of dreams and knew the world is his home, and all the people are his community. I had this ridiculous and unrealistic belief that the universe was fully on my side - it has come out to be true. 

I continue to accept only the most beautiful love, most beautiful people and the most beautiful experiences and everything. Loyalty is the most important to me. Love is the most important to me. Beauty is the most important to me. Beautiful, love and loyalty will never hurt, it takes care of my heart. 

Here I am with one of my favourite birds, peacocks surrounding me. They did it naturally and without any instructions or commands, they are not paid actors. How lucky I am that these magnificent creatures decided by themselves to circle me and surround me with their divine beauty. 

So much love to my extraordinarily beautiful team that is a part of our journey for Cinema, Love and Humanity! 

@tim_avramchuk Mika, Alya, Roman, Natali, Anastasia, Nastya and the entire team. 

And above all, to the Children of Ukraine, I love you all from the bottom of my heart.

Slava Ukraini 💙💛🇺🇦

More details to be announced. 

Thank you universe ❤️💫 

Yours truly, 
Pritan Ambroase 32 - always the lover of all beautiful 🤗🤗💫

Pritan Ambroase heading to #ukraine to help support the Children in Ukraine affected by War! 

Always in support for Ukraine, it’s people and President Zelenskyy zelenskiy_official

Full video on link in bio. 🇺🇦

I am on my way to current war zone and war torn Ukraine. I flew to Poland, then from Poland to Kyiv, it is 24 hours journey by trains and cars only. To help support President Zelenskyy win the war against russian cruelty and also to provide support to the children victims of the war. 

At Lviv, our third train, many soldiers boarded the train for Kyiv after saying by to family, friends and lovers 😭

I have barely slept more than 10 hours in 7 days, as I prepared for this humanitarian mission. 

A year since the russian terrorist attacks began on Ukraine, the Children still ask ‘Can I Go Home Now?’ and it is horrifying that no one has an answer. I hope my personally going there on this humanitarian mission and providing live updates will show to the world that Ukrainian Children need your help.

Stay tuned for the daily updates and also for the announcement of the important project which will be revealed soon. 

My updates from active war zone and war-torn Ukraine can be seen on Hollywood Insider YouTube Channel, or our instagram channel as well as my personal social media! 

Thank you to all those who continue to support me and the human rights activism I continue to be a part of. 

In my own words, “Make Humanity Viral”. 

#slavaukraini

❤️

And the Oscar for Best Documentary Feature goes to @navalnydoc which is the real life story of @navalny who is currently in russian prison for standing up as opposition leader. 

There are mixed feelings about the success of a documentary based on internal russian politics. 

But the focus here should be on Ukraine. 

The director @daniel_roher and Alex Navalny’s wife spoke out against the russian terrorist attacks on Ukraine and it’s beautiful people! 

Since @hollywoodinsider wants to bring the focus back to Ukraine, it’s important to speak of the below topic. 

This shows to us the importance of @officialpritanambroase Director Pritan Ambroase’s film CAN I GO HOME NOW? which gives a platform to the Children of Ukraine who are suffering due to an ongoing russian terrorist attacks on Ukraine. The original music is being composed by two time Oscar winner A. R. Rahman @arrahman | Multiple other heavyweights in partnership with Ambroase. This will be a @hollywoodinsider and @makehumanityviral partnership! 

#navalny #oscars #ukraine #alexeinavalny #russia

Artists will always win. Humanity will always win. I am the artist with the humanity as my soul, so victory will always belong to me as it has always done….. Learn to appreciate the artist and value humanity! We have the power within us to defeat all that threaten us. We are the ones that will work days without sleep for our art. We will use that same fierce energy to protect our art. 

Thank you to @theacademy and the excellent @janetyangofficial for the powerful Oscars for showing the power of Cinema and valuing the artists with humanity, victory is imminent #brendanfraser #michelleyeoh #kehuyquan #jamieleecurtis #guillermodeltoro #oscars 

What was your favourite Oscar moment? Tell us in comments below. 

@kehuyquan @jamieleecurtis @michelleyeoh_official @gdtreal @janetyangofficial @alberto.barbera1 @saminasyd 

#cinema #hollywood #movies #art #humanity #tuxedo #gq #italia #rolex #cartier #ukraine #armani

25 photos/videos slideshow! My Ukraine! My home Ukraine! I have been supporting and speaking up for Ukraine and my Ukrainians since 24 February 2022!  воля-Volya! 

My film ‘Can I Go Home Now?’ will make sure the answer to this question is YES for the Ukrainian Children and all my Ukrainians! 

Supporting Ukraine is equal to supporting humanity! Be on the right side of history, support Ukraine! 

@school2.news @hopeforukraine @_oksana.kovtun_ @makehumanityviral @hollywoodinsider @arrahman @dreamworks 

#ukraine

Український переклад – у коментарях

@canigohomenowrevolution

I am in the middle of making my film “Can I Go Home Now?” Here are Children of Lyceam No. 2 (School No. 2) in Vinnytsia, a city in Ukraine. I visited their classrooms, and then as the war alarm siren started, we rushed into a bunker, a classroom under the earth away from the bombs.  My humanitarian work and my film is saving lives. 

Its Easter in Greece, one of my homes. Its also easter in Ukraine, where I am right now, now one of my countries. I see all the families celebrating together. And in days like this one, its tough being so far away from my own home and family during festivals like easter, christmas, etc. As I sit in this hotel room alone, I know I have made sacrifices, especially time with my family and at home. These kids show to me that my work is valued. 

I am a film director, media figure and humanitarian - all three careers makes me travel the world to areas/countries I have never been before. Alone. I have missed many festivals and celebrations with family. I do feel guilty, especially for my mum, who always waits for me to come home for celebrations. at 16 I became a filmmaker, at 18 I started my charity foundation.  I have protested for human rights in 35 countries now. 

As I sit here in my hotel in ukraine, I know I am making this film so that I can save millions of children’s lives. I want to make sure they can come home safely. And for that I am away from home. 

Home is not defined by my nationality or passport, home to me is not a location, home is the place where I feel loved, home is one or more people to whom I belong, home is where I  know there is kindness towards me. 

This morning i woke up to more death threats. Why? Because I want to protect children. I have never gotten used to death threats. It feels weird. When ppl walk close to me on streets, I am nervous. When I hear a sound in my room, I am nervous. But I am not scared.

Human life is finite. we are born to die. I am not scared. They can kill a person, but they cannot kill my film.

@canigohomenowrevolution 

#ukraine #humanity

How was your midnight/early morning 3:30 am Thursday 4 May 2023?

My night yesterday? Missiles, rockets, explosions. My team and I were in the city called Odesa in Ukraine. Around 6 hours from capital. Around 20 of us had driven there to film a 6 year old gymnast who had lost leg.

After a long day of filming, as my team and I were sleeping at our hotel, at 3:30 am, everyone woke up as war sirens went loud and we heard explosions nearby. Odesa was under attack. As I laid in bed, too tired to run to shelter, I heard explosions in the sky, wondering which missile/drone would hit where. My team ran to the shelter for hours. 15 shahed drones attacked odesa. 12 got destroyed in air. 3 reached targets and complete destruction.

I froze. I couldnt move. My mental and emotional health has taken a toll. I have just been here too long. Making a film is in itself a war. Now making a film in a war zone is a bigger war. A war that I am determined to win. But I struggle mentally. I am the only non-Ukrainian in a film/production/music crew of nearly 194 people. I love them, but sometimes I yearn to understand the conversations around me. My translator is too tired to translate every second of the day. Conversations happen on set that are important to me, but no one is translating. Sets are hectic, no one’s fault. I chose to come to Ukraine alone - mainly because no one from my team in USA/UK wanted to come with me, they were scared - makes sense. I chose to hire 99.5% all Ukrainian team as a part of my humanitarianism is empowering locals to help themselves without relying on outsiders. But I do feel excruciatingly lonely. Every year I spend over 80% of time away from my home countries. I rarely feel this level of loneliness. This time I feel lonely. 

Im tired. Im exhausted. I have been here 1 month and 6 days now and I can read Ukrainian - out of necessity.
No one except filmmakers understand the battles you go through to make a film. Now add to that making a film in a war zone. Now add to that, I am the only foreigner here.

I am extremely soft and hearing these kids talking of suffering, losing limbs/parents/homes is heartbreaking and unbearable for me. 

#ukraine

Trailer link in bio! 

And so the revolution begins… the film - CAN I GO HOME NOW? 

The film’s trailer has launched today at the Cannes Film Festival 2023 on the first day.

The Pritan Ambroase Film demands the world to make the answer YES to that question for the Children of Ukraine. 

A Space Where Only the Children Speak - No Adults Allowed…
Filmed in the Current War Zone of Ukraine.
Witness What the News Hides from You! 
Raw Uncensored Stories Directly from Terrorism’s Youngest Victims!

The Children are still waiting for an answer… yes or no? 
 
Original Soundtrack by Two-Time Oscar Winner A.R. Rahman. Just a teaser of his divine music here. More to come. More to feel. 

 The war is still going on…
 
The Film. The Revolution. 
Join us NOW - www.canigohomenow.com

Follow @canigohomenowrevolution 

‘Can I Go Home Now?’ is a heartbreaking, moving, and powerful documentary film that gives a voice to Children suffering from the ongoing horrific war in Ukraine. No adults are allowed to speak in this film. Rarely do Children get to have a say in a war fought by adults, and this film gives the Children a voice and a chance to speak up as they tell the story of this war in their own words. The film bears witness to their experiences, fears and hopes in a ruined landscape. Despite their circumstances, they continue to dream and hope for a better future. The film is a lesson in courage about the impact of conflict on innocent people and a testament to human resilience.

@hollywoodinsider @makehumanityviral @arrahman 

#cannes #movies #children #love #ukraine #humanity #cinema #arrahman #hollywood #pritanambroase #cannesfilmfestival

The Opening Night Ceremony at the 80th Venice Film Festival 2023. Six photos to commemorate the event! 

Thank you to @labiennale for the invites as always! 

Here to promote the unheard voices in my film “CAN I GO HOME NOW?“ | The film is currently in the final stages of post-production. All updates provides here - @canigohomenowrevolution 

The Children of Ukraine who continue to live in an active war zone have opened their hearts to tell their story in my film and give the world a look into the devastation of war. 

To us our film is a revolution for Children affected by wars. 

Thank you to my partner in crime and multi-Oscar Winner AR RAHMAN @arrahman 

Thank you to my fighter and Executive Producer Susan Bala. 
And thank you to my most loyal partner, confidant and vision-sharer Pat Arcadipane. 

Thank you to my amazing DOP @tim_avramchuk 
My two amazing editors @jerzy.patryk.zawadzki @hubert.pusek

Dyaku-yu! Thank you for everything.

This is the first time I protested on the red carpet - this time for Iran, women, art & humanity. Being a part of revolutions all over the world earned me the nickname “Rebel with a Cause”. My first revolution was when I was 7 years old. Since then, I have protested for human/animal rights in 35 countries and fought against corrupt governments/oppression/brutalities in the name of humanity! One for all and all for one! We have to speak up for others!

My love for my Iranian people is forever. The murder of Mahsa Amini by the cruel corrupt illegal regime of Iran shook me to the core. Today is the one year mark since murder of Amini, whose death sparked a long-awaited revolution by the great Iranian people against the regime. Men-women-children revolted for the liberty of women and humanity - I have supported you all from day one as I had been waiting for this revolution for many many years. The murder of Amini shattered my heart, but the revolution jolted my heart back to life. My amazing Iranian people, I have protested with you for your life - and I will continue to do so. See you all in Iran again soon. 

Women, Life, Freedom | Jin, Jiyan, Azadî |  زن، زندگی، آزادی | 
At the 80th Venice Film Festival 2023, I protested on the red carpet in support of director @saeedroustaee and Cinema/music/art in Iran, in support of Mahsa Amini and all women and the people of Iran and their humanity. @shervinine your music is the one. 

Thank you Jane Campion, Damien Chazelle, Saleh Bakri for letting me stand up for humanity with you. Jane your movie THE PIANO is the reason I became a film director and today, I protested for humanity with you. Thank you to #universe.

Thank you amazing Mr Barbera and Miss Savoldi for the invites to be a part of this protest  @alberto.barbera1 @angela.savoldi | @labiennale will always be home to me, one of my favorites.

❤️ to all my amazing Iranian people and their courage! Keep fighting till full freedom! We are with you always and forever! 

📸: @danieleventurelliphoto @andreas.rentz @dsampedro_dop @gettyimages @gettyentertainment @imago.images 

#mahsaamini #saeedroustaee #iran #jinjiyanazadi #iranian #cinema #venicefilmfestival #revolution

social_posts.post_text:
COMMENT BELOW - What is your answer? 

Do you have children? Or nephews and nieces? Or cousins? 
Is their favourite question “Can I Go Home Now?” Your answer is “yes”. 

What about to the Children in war zones? Ukraine? Syria? Congo? Iran? Ethiopia? What is your answer to them? 

Millions of Children around the world are waiting for an answer. Can I Go Home Now? What is your answer? Comment below. 

The #canigohomenow revolution has begun! 

#canigohomenow #war #peace #humanity #children #ukraine #syria #afghanistan #yemen #iran #congo #ethiopia
